title: Public banks must evolve from lenders to outcome-oriented partners to fuel innovation: Top Economist
byline: Public banks must transform from mere financiers into strategic, outcome-oriented partners to drive the mission-led innovation needed for economic transformation, according to a top economist.

title: Sri Lanka overdosed!
byline: Sri Lankans consume medicines at above-normal levels, with the health sector procuring pharmaceuticals under 863 generic categories - two-thirds imported and the rest locally manufactured - a volume that could be nearly halved through proper therapeutic guidelines, resulting in significant cost savings, Deputy Health Minister Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni said.

title: Insurance a ‘powerful engine’ for Sri Lanka’s economic revival: expert
byline: The insurance industry can serve as a powerful engine for Sri Lanka’s economic revival and stability, lessening the heavy reliance on taxation for funding national development, according to Willis Towers

title: Corporate earnings jump 57.4% in March quarter
byline: Listed companies posted 57.4 percent year-on-year increase in earnings for the March 2025 quarter, marking the sixth consecutive quarter of growth. This is as banking and consumer-led sectors

title: Over 30 ragging complaints reported in first six months, CID reveals
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) announced that it has received more than 30 complaints related to ragging incidents within the first six months of this year.

title: Final decision on grade five exam discontinuation in 2029
byline: The final decision on discontinuing the grade five scholarship examination will be made in 2029, after the committee appointed to review the exam and recommend measures to ease the pressure on students submits its report.

title: Massive data breach: 16 billion passwords from Apple, Google, Facebook & more leaked
byline: In a shocking revelation, researchers have confirmed a massive data breach involving 16 billion login credentials. This unprecedented leak includes passwords from major tech vendors and is believed to be the work of multiple infostealers.

title: CID confirms Sabaragamuwa student’s suicide linked to ragging
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has confirmed that the recent suicide of Charith Dilshan, a student of the Sabaragamuwa University, was the result of ragging by senior students.

title: Sri Lanka deports 85 Chinese nationals over criminal activities
byline: A total of 85 Chinese nationals convicted for various crimes, including cyber-related offences, were deported from Sri Lanka in the early hours of today, following legal proceedings and imprisonment, officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) confirmed.

title: UN research vessel visit not barred, but no green light for research yet – Minister
byline: While asserting that there is no restriction on the UN research vessel visiting Sri Lanka, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath yesterday clarified that no final decision has been made regarding granting permission to carry out marine research in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Tense situation at Gampaha District Hospital over alleged security negligence
byline: A tense situation was reported at the clinic complex of the Gampaha District Hospital as patients voiced their frustration over alleged negligence by the hospital’s security officers.

title: Screen overuse threatens healthy growth in preschool children
byline: Health authorities in Sri Lanka are raising concerns over the growing impact of excessive digital screen use on the mental and emotional development of preschool children, the Health Promotion Bureau said.

title: Trump hosts Pakistani army chief, disagrees with India over India-Pakistan war mediation
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump hosted Pakistan’s army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir at the White House on Wednesday in an unprecedented meeting that risked worsening a disagreement with India over the president’s claim that he stopped last month’s conflict between the nuclear-armed South Asian foes.

title: 44 vehicles, including buses, temporarily removed from Hatton-Kandy road
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has temporarily removed 44 vehicles, including private vehicles, Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and private buses, from service following a special vehicle inspection conducted yesterday along the Hatton-Kandy main road.

title: Some constructions of Southern Express way found to be not feasible: Minister
byline: Some constructions of the Southern Expressway have been found to be not feasible, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: Chamithri Rambukwella released after fulfilling bail conditions
byline: Chamithri Jayanika Rambukwella, the daughter of former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, was released on bail today (20) after fulfilling the conditions set by the court.

title: Pro-Palestinian activists break into RAF Brize Norton
byline: Pro-Palestinian activists have broken into RAF Brize Norton and sprayed two military planes with red paint in a security breach.

title: SLPP suspends Galle deputy mayor’s party membership
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has suspended the party membership of Priyantha Godagama Sahabandu, who was recently elected as the Deputy Mayor of the Galle Municipal Council.

title: Sri Lanka attracts USD 4.7 Bn in foreign investments so far
byline: The Board of Investment (BOI) of Sri Lanka reported a USD 96 million increase in Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) during the first quarter of 2025 compared to the same period in 2024.

title: Parliament will be informed of probe on ’Teacher Amma’ once it is completed: Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala assured today that all details pertaining to the function held by ’Teacher Amma’ (Hyeshika Fernando) will be presented to Parliament once it is completed.

title: Galle NPP mayor elected with SLPP support
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) councillor Sunil Gamage was elected as the Mayor of the Galle Municipal Council today (20) with 19 votes, securing the post with the backing of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) councillors.

title: Rasamanickam accuses NPP of backing Pillayan’s TMVP in Vakarai PS
byline: Batticaloa District MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam has criticised the National People’s Power (NPP) for allegedly assisting the Tamil Makkal Viduthalai Pulikal (TMVP) to gain control of the Vakarai Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: Prince William’s heart beats for Sri Lankan elephants
byline: Prince William and The Royal Foundation’s United for Wildlife programme have released the newest episode of its groundbreaking docuseries, Guardians, highlighting the individuals at the forefront of wildlife protection and conservation, focusing on an incredible team of rangers in Sri Lanka working to minimise threats of human-elephant conflict, fostering a more peaceful coexistence between wildlife and the communities living to help save this

title: NPP Balangoda PS chairman resigns
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) representative Ranjith Udaya Kumara who was elected as the Chairman of the Balangoda Pradeshiya Sabha has stepped down from his post.

title: CSE ends positively as indices rebound
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a positive note today, marking a recovery after several consecutive sessions of decline. Both the All Share Price Index (ASPI) and the S&P SL20 recorded gains, reflecting renewed investor activity.

title: Boeing representatives discuss 777-9 operations at BIA
byline: A high-level discussion on the upcoming operations of Boeing’s newest wide-body aircraft, the 777-9, was held this week at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), as part of preparations for the aircraft’s anticipated entry into service in 2026.

title: UN Human Rights Chief Volker Turk to visit Sri Lanka
byline: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka from June 23 to 26, 2025, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced today.

title: Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma resigns as MP, set to become Treasury secretary
byline: Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma has tendered his resignation as a Member of Parliament.

title: Police to relaunch crackdown on unauthorized vehicle modifications
byline: The Sri Lanka Police announced that a programme to remove unauthorized equipment and illegal modifications from vehicles will be reintroduced starting July 1.

title: Sri Lanka attracts USD 4.7 Bn in investment proposals so far
byline: The Board of Investment (BOI) of Sri Lanka reported a USD 96 million increase in Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) during the first quarter of 2025 compared to the same period in 2024.

title: Sri Lanka should join the Russia-led BRICS: Ranil
byline: Sri Lanka should join the Russia-led BRICS as it has become a grouping to be reckoned with, Former President who is on a visit to Russia said.

title: Namal hits back at Bimal over Southern Expressway claim
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa has accused Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake of misleading Parliament following the latter’s remarks about alleged irregularities in the construction of the Southern Expressway.

title: One could do very little to avoid consequences of Israel-Iran war: Bimal
byline: It is not possible to entirely avoid the economic and other consequences of a war between Israel and Iran, Minister Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: Europe, Iran foreign ministers meet, testing water for nuclear talks
byline: European foreign ministers met their Iranian counterpart on Friday hoping to test Tehran’s readiness to negotiate a new nuclear deal despite there being scant prospect of Israel ceasing its attacks soon, diplomats said.

title: Complaint filed over misuse of President’s Fund during Sirisena’s term
byline: A complaint has been lodged with the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today (20), alleging the misappropriation of Rs. 27.5 million from the President’s Fund during the tenure of former President Maithripala Sirisena in 2019.
